subject: p10975446
History: -year-old intubated patient, rule out cardiopulmonary process.
Impression: AP chest compared to : Moderately severe pulmonary edema is worsening, accompanied by increasing small-to-moderate bilateral pleural effusions and progressive moderate-to-severe cardiomegaly. Right jugular line ends in the upper right atrium. ET tube is in standard placement. No pneumothorax. Thoracic aorta is heavily calcified and at least tortuous if not dilated, but probably not acutely changed.
